name: Metropolitan Hotel

reviews.text: We had booked apartments at their nearby facility, but got an email a few days before we got there that a pipe had broken so they would give us junior suites in their courtyard instead. These rooms are usually more expensive than the apartment, and they were giving it to us at the lower price of the apartment. The people who work there are very nice. The continental + breakfast is excellent.
reviews.title: odd courtyard rooms

reviews.text: So why the the 3 stars? The courtyard rooms are very oddly designed. In both of our rooms, the showers were open to the main room. In one, someone showering could be seen through the glass front door if the curtain wasn't closed. Traveling just with a partner, this could be okay. We were traveling with our elementary and middle-school aged kids. There were also other odd choices including having the safe on a rolling coat rack (the "closet"). The rooms were very clean. For the right people these rooms could be fine, for us, there were challenges.
reviews.title: Warm hospitality

reviews.text: They are also having some noise issues right now with a bar or restaurant nearby that has not done what they are supposed to do about insulation. Our first night there it was quite loud; the second was fine. This is not the hotel's fault, but something to be aware of.
reviews.title: Just perfect

reviews.text: Hi! I often use the Metropolitan hotel in Bologna for my clients. They are always very pleased for the warm hospitality of the owners Anna and Claudio who welcome my guests as their guests visiting their home and their city. Rooms are modern, clean and confortable. If you chose this hotel for your vacation I seuggest to ask for a suite in the olive trees court, wich is a little corner of paradise! You have free internet access. Breakfast is varied and hearty. The location is great, too, just a few steps from Piazza Maggiore the main square of the city.
reviews.title: centrally located, perfectly nice, small hotel with charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was in bologna for 2 weeks and stayed at the mets apartments run by the Metropolitan Hotel. I could not have asked for any more. The servicing of the apartment was just perfect - cleaning and laundry services were excellent and the room was expensively and thoughtfully furnished. Special mention go to the Front Desk staff who were utterly charming and could not have done more to help me feel at home in bologna. Special mention to Sara on Front Desk for dealing with my very annoying and frequent requests with such charm. Having travelled all over the world and used to the very best service typically outside of Europe, it was a real joy to discover this gem with someone like Sara being the perfect hostess. I cannot recommend this enough.
reviews.title: Nice room in Olive Court

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really good value at 65 euros a night. Hotel is 5-10 mins from the main square and is on a street with plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby. Staff were very friendly and helpful, and luckily i was able to use one of the parking spaces out the front. Only complaint would be a 12 euro 0.2cl bottle of prosecco from the mini-bar.......how much!!?? :-)
reviews.title: Good location, helpful staff, nice and clean

reviews.text: We stayed in Bologna for a long weekend and truly enjoyed our stay at the Metropolitan Hotel...very clean...fair service....excellent location and good value for yr money if you book ahead of time. One minute walk to shops....restaurants...bars all very close by....12 mins to station and 10 min walk to central square. Would definately stay there again.
reviews.title: Great value for money...ideal location

reviews.text: Stayed in one of the apartments. Very modern. Spotless. Wonderful service and nice breakfast. Would definitely recommend.
reviews.title: Beautiful place to stay
Beautiful Modern and Large
reviews.text: What a pleasure it was to stay in the apartments! Modern, light and large, with comfy beds and a small kitchen area. The hotel staff was extraordinary and could not do enough for us. The breakfast was fantastic! And the shower- wow! My only criticism is that there was no phone connection to the hotel but they are fixing that. Highly rcommended.

We have traveled to Bologna for business for over a decade, and this is by far the friendliest hotel we've experienced. The front desk staff, the bellman, and the breakfast room attendants always seemed genuinely happy, and were eager to please. We will never need another hotel - we've found our home in Bologna!
reviews.title: Friendliest Bologna hotel!
Execellent front desk staff and location
reviews.text: The hotel kindly honored our request for an upgrade given the room price of our standard room was much less now than two months ago. The front desk person helped us get the most convenient parking place in Bologna. The room is comfortable and we are able to get a cross draft for cooling (too early for A/C). The bathroom is large but has some mold in the grout in the shower. We had to request our room to be serviced on of three days, but it was quickly remedied. The front desk helped us with some calls in Italian for things we were looking for. They also gave us the location of a laundromat which surprisingly had an English-speaking attendant. Breakfast included many little choices.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Metropolitan is the perfect place to stay in Bologna - beautifully decorated modern rooms, fabulous central location not far at all from the Piazza Maggiore, and everyone was so friendly and welcoming. They were especially helpful to accomodate us for an extra day than we originally booked so we ended up staying for 5 nights and couldn't have been happier. Thank you Claudia and all of the staff. I can't wait to come back to stay at the metropolitan again. I would also recommend going to Terzi for their coffee, Stefino for granitas and gelato, and Zanarini Cafe for the pistachio and pear brioche(croissants).
reviews.title: loved our stay at the Metropolitan

reviews.text: We recently spent 3 nights in this well-located hotel full of small boutiquey touches in Bologna.
reviews.title: Pretty hotel in a great location

reviews.text: Check-in and check-out went very smoothly. The personnel at breakfast were friendly and welcoming and did a great job making sure things were replaced as fast as they ran out. The breakfast is very good for italian standards, a lot of fresh fruit, cereals, etc. Our room was big and the bathroom had all that we needed. The only negative was that the way the hotel is set up means that you can hear people to-ing and fro-ing in the corridors if you are near the lift as we were.
reviews.title: An easter away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a great position, near to the main action. A warm welcome, all the reception staff seemed good and spoke english. The room was medium size, with a good size bathroom. As usual, there seemed no shelf to put your toiletries, and the shower similarly had nowhwere to put shower gel/shampoo. And was very slippery, I had to go and buy a non slip mat. B ut other than that, the breakfast was good, with a helpful waitress who brought whatever you wanted, although there was the usual buffet. I managed to get a good price, and all in all was really pleased with the hotel, and would recommend it. There are cafes, bars and shops on your doorstep, all temptin, if a little expensive.
reviews.title: Great foyer, tired rooms

reviews.text: Arrived in the middle of snow chaos, Bologna train station was madhouse. Easy 5min taxi ride to hotel. (If not for all the snow on the ground, the train station is a easy walk away) Hotel staff were warm and welcoming. Very glad to have a properly heated bedroom when it was -10 C outside, friendly porter helped with luggage. (BTW, you can actually turn down the radiator to a lower setting when you've warmed up enough)
reviews.title: Definitely coming back...

reviews.text: Loved the hotel breakfast, would stay there again just to eat it. Warm and crunchy croissants, cold cuts (mortadella was fabulous) and delicious variety of fresh fruit, all beautifully presented.
reviews.title: One night stay in blizzard conditions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Aside from the fantastic location (close to shops, train station, etc) The Metropolitan is also within walking distance of lots of good restaurants and the hotel crew was well informed on this front and gave excellent recommendations (unlike some other hotels i have stayed in where they simply try to suggest tourist places).
reviews.title: Warm and stylish hotel in excellent, central location

reviews.text: Also tried one of their new luxury apartments, closeby to the main hotel. Very spacious and chic, perfect for those who want more space or kitchen facilities.
reviews.title: My home in Bologna

reviews.text: Am hoping to return to Bologna one day when the weather is better and the Metropolitan is definitely where I'll be staying.
reviews.title: Perfect place for an Italian weekend getaway.

description: Simple, minimalist, inspired to Far East suggestions..Design Hotel in Bologna The Metropolitan Hotel has been completely renovated according to the news hospitality concepts.Modern comforts melt into an exclusive inner design combined to a long tradition of family of Hoteliers.The Metropolitan Hotel is perfectly located in the Medieval city centre of Bologna, in a walking area a few steps from Piazza Maggiore.Exotic flavours from Far East will seduce guests along the enchanting and relaxing atmosphere of the breakfast room to taste several Eastern teas an herbs infusions together with fragrant brioches and a creative selection of fresh fruits.Our Staff will be glad to suggest you the best Restaurants of the City, the most exclusive Shops and Outlet and to arrange your visit to the legendary cathedrals of motors: homeland to Ferrari, Ducati, Lamborghini and Maserati brands.And for those who want to stay in elegant apartments, maintaining the benefits and services of a hotel, are available to the new MET'S APARTMENTSParking at 100mt from the Hotel (price reserved for our customers).
